speaker: Marcus
lines: You’ve got groups like the Church, the Law, that if this town were to become incorporated, they would lose a pretty big handhold in the Crescent Territory.

speaker: Dylan
lines: I loved Jeremiah Blackwell, and he loved Ann.

speaker: Augustus
lines: What is the antidote to despair? Well, my friend, it is action.

speaker: Errol
lines: Nice to meet you too, uh, Banshee. Yeah?

speaker: Banshee
lines: Yeah. Let’s get down to business. I want to help you in this.

speaker: Travis
lines: The spirit that has been occupying the body in front of you leaves it and the Banshee is gone from the room. So you open the envelope, a key falls out, uh, a house key. You pull out the piece of paper that’s in there, you turn it over. It simply says, “Don’t trust Connors.”

speaker: [Theme music (The Adventure Zone
lines: Dust Theme by Griffin McElroy) plays]

speaker: Travis
lines: So you guys wanna know who did it?

speaker: Clint
lines: I already know. I’ve already figured it out. I just didn’t want to reveal it in Episode 2.

speaker: Travis
lines: Now this is a thing you used to do when we played Clue or you watched mo- Where you go like “Oh,” and we’d be like “What?” and you’d be like “Mmm, you’ll figure it out.” [crosstalk] You never knew.

speaker: Clint
lines: [crosstalk] And I was always- I was always right.

speaker: Travis
lines: No, there is no way—

speaker: Justin
lines: I did once see Dad solve a Clue game after two rounds of clues, it was amazing.

speaker: Travis
lines: I have to think he cheated, I still can’t believe—

speaker: Griffin
lines: [crosstalk] He, in some way, cheated.

speaker: Justin
lines: Don’t— don’t reopen this wound Travis. Please.

speaker: Travis
lines: Okay.

speaker: Travis
lines: So, we just put out Episode 3, so it’s fairly recent, so I don’t think we have to go over all the clues again, but so— can you guys give me a quick, like, where you’re at now, what your plan is, I will say I want—

speaker: Justin
lines: Can I say something? Let’s go over the clues again!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, I think we at least have an idea now of what is relevant? It’s—

speaker: Justin
lines: Here’s the thing I’m starting with Unless it is Liam, I don’t have a good— I don’t have any other good suspects.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Well I think if you want to look at motive, I kind of suspected the sheriff before we got the grim omen from the Banshee because if the town gets incorporated, the Law, I think, loses a foothold in town, right? [Justin Right.] If they bring in more proper infrastructure and you know, sort of codify the lower case L “law” in town, I think the sheriff loses something and so that might be a reason why they would commit a murder. The thing is—

speaker: Justin
lines: Now who was the sheriff vouching for so hard last time?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, Tommy Nox.

speaker: Justin
lines: Tommy Nox, yeah.

speaker: Griffin
lines: So maybe there’s a collaboration that was happening there. The thing- the thing that makes this case so curious is the— [Travis Benjamin Button] Is how it actually happened. Is the— is that they— somebody knew where Jeremiah and where Dylan was gonna be. Somebody killed Jeremiah in the street, I’m assuming with these gloves, although that could just be a big red herring from Travis, and then somehow got them cleaned and back to the house where Liam was staying before we took notice? There’s a lot— there’s just so many question marks still out there.

speaker: Clint
lines: I think we need to lock in some things. I think the gloves is a good example. We have had nothing else that has even come close to being a murder weapon. I think every indicator points to the gloves— I say we lock in the glove as the murder weapons.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Unless that’s exactly what fucking Travis wants! Well, maybe we’ll find something in Sheriff Connors’ house. We’re about to go get a big clue, I feel like. So instead—

speaker: Justin
lines: Let’s go kick open Sheriff Connors’ doors.

speaker: Travis
lines: Wait, was I supposed to be writing this down? Like, am I supposed to know what we’re doing? Oh, no. I’m making this up as we go along, babyyy. Alright—

speaker: Justin
lines: Aw yeah, baby.

speaker: Travis
lines: Aw yeah, baby.

speaker: Griffin
lines: What time is it as we make our way to the address listed on the card?

speaker: Travis
lines: I will say it’s about 6 o’clock. [Griffin Fuuuck.] I mean, you’ve still got some time, but it’s getting there, you know?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. I mean, best case scenario for me is we don’t solve it in time and then we have some, like, big hero moment at the sheriff’s station where we like, fend off the whole town gunslinger-style. Just—

speaker: Travis
lines: A whole Tombstone moment.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Right. This is our justice, et cetera.

speaker: Travis
lines: Every town has a story, Dry River has a legend.

speaker: Clint
lines: Steel and lead, friend.

speaker: Justin
lines: Speaking as someone whose greatest combat ability is um, not getting hurt by things, that sounds a little bit underwhelming to me. I’d like to crack the case, if we could.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Alright.

speaker: Travis
lines: Alright, so you’re heading to the address on the card with the house key given to you by the Banshee. When you approach the home it is, in fact, to confirm Griffin’s suspicions, it is Sheriff Connors’ home. A couple doors down— about three doors down from the jail house.

speaker: Griffin
lines: How many doors down?

speaker: Travis
lines: Three doors.

speaker: Griffin
lines: [muttering] If I go crazy then will you still call me Superman? [normal voice] Y’all remember that jam? So if it’s near the jail, then it’s not on Carrion Street then, right?

speaker: Travis
lines: Correct.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Farts. Okay. I was just saying like, there’s no bells here, I’m fucking useless.

speaker: Travis
lines: No, but the streets are clear, the windows are dark, you know that the sheriff is still at— You left him at the jail. He said he would keep an eye and protect Dylan, so you’re fairly confident the house is empty. You know from your intel that Connors lives alone. So you can feel pretty confident about using the key and whatnot without having to worry about repercussions.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Well, I— still, we should be cautious, I feel like.

speaker: Travis
lines: Well, yeah. You’re sneaking into somebody’s house. I was just giving you like, if this was like— if this was a Quest for Glory game, here’s what you know. This is a low stealth check, you know what I mean?

speaker: Griffin
lines: So there’s this thing called Let it Out where you extend your senses, supernatural or otherwise to like, just like do like— I’m trying to figure out a way to use my keen wolf senses to like, see if there’s anyone inside the house or any sort of dangers we should be aware of.

speaker: Travis
lines: Do it, babyy. I’ve been listening to too much Magic Tavern, I can’t stop.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, that’s a six, which is not great, but plus one for Spirit, so that’s a seven. So it’s a hit. So, I do mark corruption…

speaker: Travis
lines: Uh-huh.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Racking that shit up! Oh, no, I’m just at two, it’s fine. And yeah, I just sorta, like, take a beat, stop my companions and, like, take a deep sniff, a hard sniff.

speaker: Travis
lines: So I will say that you do sense some light magical warding on the door, just kinda think, like, security system, you know, like… but not— since you used your supernatural tec— it doesn’t seem to connect anywhere, more of, like, this way, someone would know if someone had gone in, but it wouldn’t necessarily raise an alarm or anything like that. It’s fairly common, this idea of, like, “There was someone in my house,” but it doesn’t connect to a more intricate system.

speaker: Griffin
lines: They got that on the window?

speaker: Travis
lines: Window and door.

speaker: Griffin
lines: So there’s no way of going inside this house without somebody knowing about it.

speaker: Travis
lines: Well—

speaker: Griffin
lines: Well…

speaker: Errol
lines: Hey, Gandy, there’s a little bit of magic something-or-other on the doors and windows here, into the house. You—

speaker: Gandy
lines: I have a couple of options. I have a teleport spell.

speaker: Errol
lines: Okay?

speaker: Gandy
lines: Where I can teleport someone a short distance… it seems to me that would get you past any kind of wards to keep you out.

speaker: Errol
lines: I mean, you can bamf one of us, right, but then the other two are still gonna be—

speaker: Justin
lines: Augustus floats through the wall.

speaker: Errol
lines: Oh, yeah, I forgot, okay, so—

speaker: Justin
lines: And he looks at everybody from inside, through the window.

speaker: Augustus
lines: Hello!

speaker: Errol
lines: … Hi, Augustus, that’s a neat trick, I forgot that that’s why, uh, why you earn the big bucks. Gandy, why don’t you just ‘port on in there and I’ll keep an eye out out here?

speaker: Gandy
lines: Very well!

speaker: Clint
lines: So… she— oh, nice. In channeling, she’s channeling, that’s a 10…

speaker: Griffin
lines: Do you have to ch— sorry, do you have to— I don’t know how the channeling works, but you did it last time and you got three Hold, do you not just continue to spend that Hold, or is there, like, a certain amount of time that you have to go between channelings?

speaker: Clint
lines: I dunno, Trav? Trav, is it—?

speaker: Travis
lines: Yeah, sure.

speaker: Griffin
lines: “When you channel and collect your magics, roll wi-” Yeah, I guess- oh, you can’t channel again this scene. That’s what it is. So it’s, like, scene by scene. So, I guess this is a new scene and you can do it again.

speaker: Clint
lines: Okay. I rolled a 10, so that’s…

speaker: Travis
lines: Hold three.

speaker: Clint
lines: That’s pretty much a Hold three, so a really cool Star Trek kind of effect, twinkle twinkle twinkle, and then I’m inside the room with Augustus.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Mmkay. And I’m gonna, like, walk down the stairs off the porch a bit so as not to arouse suspicion, and just sorta keep an eye out down the street.

speaker: Travis
lines: [joking] Okay, well, I could follow Gandy and Gus here, but instead, they’ll do whatever, and I think I’m just gonna spend the next hour with Errol on the street. Errol, what’re you doing? You know, just looking around, kicking some dirt, whistling— oh, no, don’t whistle, it’ll draw— oh, what am I going to— [serious] okay, so I go with Gus and Gandy.

speaker: Travis
lines: So, you enter the house, it’s, you know, it’s dark, there’s no candles lit or lanterns, the only thing you get is kinda the ambient— I was gonna say “moonlight,” but here we are, we’re near 6 o’clock, so the moon is real low, so you’re just getting a little bit of ambient light. Gus, I’m gonna say that that’s probably not so much of a problem for you. Gandy, do you have anything that would help you here, I mean, it doesn’t even have to be magical! You could always just, like, light a candle or something.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Knowing Gandy, if there is an opportunity for something— for a magical answer to an everyday dilemma, I feel like you have some sort of, y’know, enchanted mag-light.

speaker: Clint
lines: And so you are correct, sir!

speaker: Travis
lines: Excellent, excellent, excellent, excellent.

speaker: Clint
lines: She has what’s called the V-Torc. It’s a gold torc she wears around her neck. It’s an artifact, and it has a natural, ambient light that she can use. And it just kind of suffuses the general area around her and Augustus with a warm golden glow.

speaker: Justin
lines: Mmm.

speaker: Clint
lines: Which goes right through Augustus and…

speaker: Justin
lines: It’s very nice.

speaker: Travis
lines: Excellent. So, as you enter the room, here in the— you know, his kind of living quarters what you see is on the wall newspaper clippings about his time in kind of more established cities back east, the incorporated territories, where you see a much younger but still clearly Sheriff Connors as a young beat cop, in these more established- in this more established city, which I have not picked a name for but I’m just gonna call it right now the Big City, the BC.

speaker: Clint
lines: That’s “Bigg” with two G’s.

speaker: Travis
lines: Yeah, B-I-G-G, Bigg the Cat.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And “Cityy” with two Y’s.

speaker: Travis
lines: Cityy with two Y’s. In Bigg Cityy. And you find newspaper clippings about this young fresh-faced cop who it seems like was very successful. And then they just kind of stop, you know. And the last you see a young man about 25, and then suddenly there’s no more newspaper clippings. And that’s about all you see here in kind of the— I don’t want to say “living room” ‘cause it’s not really that so much as just like, a chair, you know, a table. It doesn’t look super lived in. You kind of get the impression that Sheriff Connors spends most of his time at the sheriff’s office. He only pretty much only comes back here to eat and sleep.

speaker: Clint
lines: Is there any more detail in the last newspaper clipping that we found. Anything at all that would indicate what happened?

speaker: Griffin
lines: And then he turned evil! “Beat cop goes bad!”

speaker: Clint
lines: Well, if something bad happened, he messed up or something, that would kind of explain why he has been, you know, exiled to this place.

speaker: Travis
lines: The last story— the last story you can see— is about Connors making the arrest of a low-level enforcer for a crime family in the Bigg Cityy.

lines: What’s the enforcer’s name?

lines: The enforcer’s name is…

speaker: Clint
lines: Flint Chittles.

speaker: Travis
lines: Flint Chittles.

lines: Woah, okay, that’s amazing, ‘cause I didn’t think—

lines: It all comes back!

speaker: Travis
lines: [crosstalk] It all ties back.

speaker: Justin
lines: [crosstalk] It all ties together.

lines: Let me see, I’ll give you that name in a moment. Once I look at Twitter.

speaker: Clint
lines: So it’s not Flint Chittles.

speaker: Travis and Justin in unison
lines: It’s not Flint Chittles.

speaker: Clint
lines: That was some good storytelling on my part.

speaker: Justin
lines: Who I— I don’t recall who—

speaker: Travis
lines: It’s actually just some amazing memory on Dad’s part.

speaker: Justin
lines: I just don’t recall who Flint Chittles was.

speaker: Griffin
lines: He runs one of the mining companies— or I guess is the manager at the…

lines: No, it had something to do with— I thought it had something to do with the Augustus Parsons Cashew Company.

lines: Ah, right.

speaker: Travis
lines: The name is Bishop, named after listener Holly Bishop on Twitter, thank you for tweeting about the show. Bishop, he was a low-level enforcer for a crime family in the Bigg Cityy. It doesn’t mention what crime family. It’s not even a big article, it seems to be kind of a two-paragraph, maybe buried on like, you know page five of the newspaper kind of deal.

speaker: Clint
lines: So a dead end.

speaker: Justin
lines: I’m going to extend my senses. I too can Let it Out with my ghostly powers. So I’m going to—

speaker: Travis
lines: I keep wanting to sing Let It Go and I want you all to appreciate that I haven’t yet.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Thank you Travis.

speaker: Justin
lines: Well, considering that it’s Let it Out, that is admirable restraint.

speaker: Clint
lines: [To the tune of Let It Go] Let it out, let it out!

speaker: Justin
lines: No— well, okay. Well.

speaker: Travis
lines: [crosstalk] Done it. You are my puppet, Father!

speaker: Justin
lines: [crosstalk] I’m gonna roll… that’s a… what is that, eight? Plus Spirit, which, I’m a ghost, so that’s two. So it’s a 10.

speaker: Griffin
lines: So you can choose two effects or take one and no corruption. And I bet I know which one you’re gonna do.

speaker: Justin
lines: I’m gonna ignore the corruption and—

speaker: Griffin
lines: Woah, nevermind, I was wrong.

speaker: Justin
lines: Just kidding, ha ha.

speaker: Justin
lines: I’m gonna extend my senses, supernatural or otherwise and I’m going to take one forward on my next roll.

speaker: Travis
lines: Okay, you feel two powerful sources. Both of them coming from the direction upstairs. One about, I would say at least twice if not more powerful than the other. But both seem to be going away from kind of his living area and kitchenette and heading upstairs.

speaker: Justin
lines: Okay, I’m gonna float upstairs then.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Hey, what’s going on outside?

speaker: Travis
lines: Well it’s a good question. What does Errol see? First of all, I will say that maybe Errol can see a little bit of that golden glow. Just a little bit, but enough that, you know it ain’t something you’re crazy about seeing there in the window, it ain’t exactly low profile, but the street is still fairly empty. You hear rustling, you can see some lights in windows further down the street, but there’s no one out at this time.

speaker: Griffin
lines: If I see lights in windows, am I assuming that people are starting to wake up?

speaker: Travis
lines: Oh yeah.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Farts.

speaker: Travis
lines: Far down the street you can see the worker housing. It’s starting to light up. You know you still have a while. The shift doesn’t start at the mine for while.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Travis
lines: But it’s getting there. Um. Tell me, how’s Errol feeling?

speaker: Justin
lines: I was going upstairs to look at the super magic clues and we’re really getting B-roll right now? Like this is what we’re doing?

speaker: Griffin
lines: I’ll be quick I’m feeling nervous.

speaker: Travis
lines: Okay, so as you float upstairs you reach what is clearly Connors’ bedroom, and you see in a corner something that you are not surprised to see, and that is a shrine to… one moment, I’ve lost my notes.

speaker: Justin
lines: Jesus?

speaker: Travis
lines: A shrine to Jesus.

speaker: Griffin
lines: “Dear Jesus, give me the power I need to do all the good crime busting today.”

speaker: Griffin
lines: “Help me get all the good clues, Jeezy, and, uh—”

speaker: Travis
lines: You see a shrine to Limdafel (sp?), who you know is the, kind of demonic presence that The Law — capital T, capital L — was founded by the worshippers of Limdafel. It’s the order— what you know from just general intel, is the followers of Limdafel, The Law, believe in power through order. Now what you weren’t expecting to see is the whole shrine seems to be covered in like a fairly fine but clear layer of dust. There is, as with most shrines you’ve seen, a book laid open. This is how the followers tend to communicate with the people they worship and follow, but the book is burned out through the center. And on investigation, it is clear that the fire kind of— it’s seems that the fire— whatever burned it out was from the middle of the book, and not from outside-in. [Others “hmm”ing] And that is the less powerful supernatural presence or power you are feeling. There is a closet, and that’s where you feel the more powerful supernatural power.

speaker: Augustus
lines: Now, Gandy, my impulse is to see what is inside the closet. Would you like to open the door to the closet or would you like me to just sort of duck in there?

speaker: Gandy
lines: I have a very strange feeling, but I’m afraid… that if—

speaker: Augustus
lines: I understand.

speaker: Gandy
lines: —that if it’s magical in origin it might even harm you. How about if I cast Shielding…

speaker: Augustus
lines: Yes, I believe a—

speaker: Gandy
lines: …to protect us both before we open the closet?

speaker: Augustus
lines: Yes, I believe a bit of Prestidigitation is indeed called for.

lines: Okay so she casts Shielding, which comes off another one of her artifacts. She’s got this jet carved bracelet around her… her…

speaker: Griffin
lines: Wrist?

speaker: Clint
lines: …wrist! Which would be a good place for a bracelet.

speaker: Travis
lines: Yes.

lines: Do I need to roll anything?

lines: No, so you still have your— you still have two holds left.

lines: No—

lines: I used one.

speaker: Travis
lines: You have two—

speaker: Clint
lines: Oh no, I rolled up again. Okay, so I have two holds left, so I’m gonna use this shielding and…

speaker: Travis
lines: Now, if you want to shield everybody in a small area that’s your last two holds, just so you know.

speaker: Clint
lines: Right, that’s right. I use two holds to provide plus one armor to everybody in a small area, and that includes me and Augustus, right?

speaker: Travis
lines: Correct.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yep.

speaker: Clint
lines: Okay, so I cast this Shielding and then I… she reaches out and opens the closet door.

speaker: Travis
lines: It’s a good thing you cast that shielding because what is released from the closet is a blast of wild magic. And what you see inside is a second shrine, this one very clearly actively being used. And let’s, um… let’s do Face to a Name. Or Name to a Face.

lines: Wait, did Dad protect us with a shielding spell?

lines: Yeah.

lines: Dad!

lines: Woah!

lines: Goodbye, Dolly!

lines: [crosstalk] Thank you for listening to the last episode of The Adventure Zone.

lines: Did I hear that from the street?

lines: I would say maybe like the second floor windows kinda rattled a little bit.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

lines: Definitely not, like, crazy, but like, you look up and you see a little kinda maybe swell in the glow you could’ve already seen up there, and the windows rattle a little bit. Yeah, so Gandy and Gus, maybe give me a Name to a Face kinda roll here. Maybe that that will… I’m trying to think of a way that you would identify the shrine. And I think that that’s what would make sense.

lines: Is that one of Gandy’s moves? I don’t see it on this—

speaker: Griffin
lines: It’s a faction move. So you just roll two d6.

lines: Okay. Five and three. Do I add anything to it?

speaker: Travis
lines: So it’s an eight.

lines: You roll with Faction, and right now I don’t think we know what the faction’s like— If it’s a god—

lines: [crosstalk] Okay, so, Power.

lines: —it may… Power. Okay.

lines: Oh no, sorry, it is Wild.

lines: You know what, I got a plus one to Wild and I rolled a nine, so I got a 10.

lines: Eight, and then my Power faction is two.

speaker: Travis
lines: That’s okay ‘cause Gus knows this, through all of your ghostly learnings. You recognize this as a shrine to Amdafel (sp?), who is Limdafel’s brother. Amdafel, you know, is the demonic presence whose worshippers believe in power through chaos. Amdafel is the far wilder, less predictable, far more dark sibling of Limdafel. And sitting on that shrine is a similar book to the one that you saw on Limdafel’s shrine, but this one is not burned out, it’s just sitting there waiting for you to open it.

lines: No thank you.

lines: I… I’ve gotta read it.

lines: Oh yeah, yeah!

speaker: Travis
lines: So when you touch the cover of the book, it springs open, but that’s — here’s the thing — normal for this kind of shrine communication. And what you see is the last communication that happened between Connors and Amdafel, and on the left-hand page is written in fairly normal handwriting, “What are your orders?” And on the right-hand page, in a far more scrawly, jerky handwriting is, “Stop the deal no matter what.”

speaker: Griffin
lines: I think it might be a clue, guys.

lines: [giddily] Oh absolutely! Do you have any idea what it would be like to communicate with this entity on a regular basis, answer the questions of life and death and maybe even get some penmanship tips because this is really bad cursive here.

lines: Topical! Um, so—

speaker: Connors
lines: When I started as a cop, I thought I could change but there’s so much— not just red tape, but corruption. People for whom money was more important than right and wrong and justice, and... I was just beginning to make a difference shutting down families that were hurting people, that were doing wrong. And then my commanding officer told me to drop it, to let it go, to be satisfied with what I’d done and move on to other things. And I did a little digging and it turned out that my CO was getting paid off by the family, and when I tried to confront it, they tried to transfer me and I walked away.

speaker: And I came out here. Came out here to where I could make a difference without having to answer to anybody but myself. And I’ve worked--I’ve worked hard--for the last thirty years to try to change things here, and I’ve… [sighs] You can’t imagine what this town was like when I got here. It was constant bloodshed, and over the last couple years I’ve seen this town heading that way again. And I’m not gonna let bureaucracy come in here, I’m not gonna let red tape come in here, I’m not gonna let corruption come in here and stop me from making this place better. And so… yes, I realize that order wasn’t what the Crescent Territory needed anymore. And things had to be done. And listen, I— I’m not proud of the decisions that I’ve made. But it’s what had to be done to keep people safe, do you understand that?

speaker: Travis
lines: Okay. So, here’s the thing about werewolves. The closer you get to the full moon, the more powerful they are. And the higher moon is in the sky, the more powerful they are and the more— the easier it is for them to transform and to harness that power. So on the days before and after the full moon, it’s harder for them to channel it. And as especially closer to sunset or sunrise, the harder it is for them to channel it. The amount of energy, the amount of emotion that it takes to harness that full power at those times, it’s almost unheard of. So when the now hulking figure of Dylan Mathis cannonballs through his cell door, you get the impression he’s pretty goddamn pissed.

speaker: He charges at Connors, Connors goes to turn the gun on him, but before he can, Dylan grabs his hand and you hear a crunch. speaker: Travis
lines: So far away, but not nearly as far as you might think, in the underbelly of Crescent City, we see a dark doorway. We see a figure, shrouded, step through that doorway and walk down a dark hallway. They enter a room, and that room appears to be empty. A table. A chair. A lantern. Lit, but revealing nothing. The figure draws back its shroud, and we recognize Isabella Slate. Isabella Slate says

lines: You wanted to see me?

speaker: Travis
lines: And unseen by human eyes, the Banshee smiles.
